snippet: Television producers wince when networks turn to studies of focus groups, unless it’s good news.
abstract: Focus groups are loved by television networks but often worry producers, who feel the numbers do not always tell the full story, even if the input is valuable; many times the results are used selectively, whether good or bad, to make the case for a television program.
lead_paragraph: Television producers wince when networks turn to studies of focus groups, unless it’s good news.

headline.seo: Networks Rely on Audience Research to Choose Shows
headline.main: Programmers Keep Shows’ Prospects in Focus (Groups)
